heading: 2 Introduction
text: Jupyter Labto install mac: pip3 install jupyterlab terminalto upgrade pip: pip3 install --upgrade pip terminalcheck python versionPythonPython called interpreted language. Compiled languages examine entire program compile time, able warn whole class errors prior execution. contrast, Python interprets script line line executes . Python stop executing entire program encounters error (unless error expected handled programmer, advanced subject ’ll cover later course).[Tip:] sys built-module contains many system-specific parameters functions, including Python version use. using , must explicitly import .
code:
!python -V# Check the Python Version

import sys
print(sys.version)## 3.10.3 (v3.10.3:a342a49189, Mar 16 2022, 09:34:18) [Clang 13.0.0 (clang-1300.0.29.30)]

heading: 2.1 Types of objects in Python
text:
Python object-oriented language. many different types objects Python. Let’s start common object types: strings, integers floats. Anytime write words (text) Python, ’re using character strings (strings short). common numbers, hand, integers (e.g. -1, 0, 100) floats, represent real numbers (e.g. 3.14, -42.0).Object Typesinteger = 10float = 10.1string = “Hello”boolean = Truefloat integernumeric stringstring numericit transform directly integer herebut works transforming float integer.booleanboolean numericTrue becomes 1numeric boolean0 becomes False
numbers True
code:
a = 10.123
type(a)## <class 'float'>b = int(a)
b## 10type(b)## <class 'int'>a_string = str(a)
a_string## '10.123'float("1.1")## 1.1int("1.123")int(float("10.123"))bl = True
bl## Truetype(bl)## <class 'bool'>int(bl)## 1bool(-100)## Truebool(0)## False

heading: 2.3.1 Indices
text:
Positive Index
python indices start 0
R indices start 1Negative Index
-1 corresponds last element
code:
myname = "Davut Emrah Ayan"

print("Object myname:", myname)
# examples## Object myname: Davut Emrah Ayanprint(myname[0], 'is the first element of myname object')## D is the first element of myname objectprint(myname[6], 'is the 6th element of myname object')## E is the 6th element of myname objectprint(myname[-1], 'is the last element of myname object')## n is the last element of myname object

heading: 2.3.2 Slicing
text: Full versionobject[: : increment]Short versionShorter versionNumeric string easier see.Length object : len()character length element length
code:
print("Object:", myname)## Object: Davut Emrah Ayanprint("From 0 index to 5th index, by 1, is", myname[0:5:1])## From 0 index to 5th index, by 1, is Davutprint("Object myname:", myname)## Object myname: Davut Emrah Ayanprint(myname[0:5], "is the first 5 element of the object")## Davut is the first 5 element of the objectnum = "0123456789"
print(num[::2], "every 2 other element")## 02468 every 2 other elementprint(num[::3], "every 3 other element")## 0369 every 3 other elementprint(num[::4], "every 4 other element")## 048 every 4 other elementprint(num[::5], "every 5 other element")## 05 every 5 other elementlen(myname)## 16

heading: 2.3.3 Concatenate
code:
statement = "KU" + " is the best!"  
statement## 'KU is the best!'myname[0:5] + " is the best!"## 'Davut is the best!'myname[0:6] * 3## 'Davut Davut Davut '

heading: 2.4 Escape
text:
\n : new line
\t : tab spaceBackward slash ’' used escape charactersraw string
code:
# new line
print("Life \nIs \nGood!")## Life 
## Is 
## Good!# tab space
print("Life\tIs\tGood!")## Life Is  Good!print(
  r"Life is good!"
)## Life is good!

heading: 2.5 Immutable
text: string objects immutable, can change part indexing
code:
any_string = "Life is good!"

any_string[5:7] = "was"

# TypeError: 'str' object does not support item assignment

heading: 2.6 loop thru strings
code:
my_txt = "life is good!"

for i in my_txt:
  print(i)## l
## i
## f
## e
##  
## i
## s
##  
## g
## o
## o
## d
## !

heading: 2.7 Useful Methods used with strings
text:
uppercase/lowercaseupper() : strings uppercase2.replace methodreplace(): replace part string
syntax: string.replace(oldvalue, newvalue, count)
code:
"Ohh! my life!".upper()## 'OHH! MY LIFE!'"OHH! MY LIFE!".lower()## 'ohh! my life!'"is it lowercase".islower()## True"IS IT UPPERCASE".isupper()## True#example
query = '''
select all_columns 
from my_table'''
new_query = query.replace("my_table", "new_table_name")
print(new_query)## 
## select all_columns 
## from new_table_name
